Subject: Re: [junit] Contribution idea: assertions that directly support Java 8's Optional

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset=utf-8

Kevin,

I can understand you not wanting to require JDK 8. If I am not mist=
aken, you can support Java 8 classes but keep compatibility with Java 6 if =
you use JDK 8 to compile the code with JDK 6 as the target. This is from Ol=
iver Gierke=E2=80=99s comment in Stefan=E2=80=99s link here https://github.=
com/hamcrest/JavaHamcrest/issues/82#issuecomment-101392293 <https://github.=
com/hamcrest/JavaHamcrest/issues/82#issuecomment-101392293>.

Best,
Mark


=
> On Oct 4, 2015, at 7:04 PM, Kevin Cooney =E2=98=95 kcooney@... [jun=
it] <junit@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> 
> 
> JUnit depends on JDK5. The next =
major version will likely require JDK6. We don't want to require JDK8.
> 
>=
 Have you looked at Truth?
> 
> On Oct 4, 2015 11:39 AM, "Mark Silvis masil=
vis22@... <mailto:masilvis22@...> [junit]" <junit@yahoogroups.c=
om <mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com>> wrote:
>  
> I would like to contribute =
to JUnit, and I think I have a good idea for a feature. I=E2=80=99ve found =
that it would be nice to have assertions that explicitly supported Java 8=
=E2=80=99s Optional class. I=E2=80=99m thinking something along the lines o=
f assertEmpty() and assertPresent(). Would such an addition be welcomed?
> =

> Thanks,
> Mark
> 
> 
> 


--Apple-Mail=_36FC73D6-5E0E-4C76-9831-90EE6AC40B4B
